text: Richard Arvin Overton (May 11, 1906 - December 27, 2018) was an American supercentenarian. He was the oldest verified surviving American World War II veteran, as well as the oldest American man. In 2013 he was honored by President Barack Obama. On that same Memorial Day, Overton met with Texas Governor Rick Perry. He was born in Bastrop County, Texas. Overton served in the South Pacific from 1940 through 1945, including stops in Hawaii, Guam, Palau and Iwo Jima. He left the U.S. Army in October 1945. During an NBA game between the San Antonio Spurs and the Memphis Grizzlies on March 24, 2017, Overton was honored during a half-time break. He lived in Austin, Texas. When he was 82 years old, his wife, Wilma, died in 1988.Texas Death Index, Wilma Overton. Accessed 1 September 2015. On May 11, 2016, Overton became a supercentenarian.
